page.title: 04BIRDS CUCKFIELD RURAL
page.content: The land of this area is used mainly for mixed farming, with pastureland and fields,divided by hedgerows and some patches of deciduous woodland. There are also some new plantings of conifers. This environment supports quite a wide variety of bird life. One of the local residents has studied the birds in the area,and as well as the more common ones, which include Robins ,Wrens ,Tits,Blackbirds,Starlings, Rooks,Crows and Pigeons, he has seen Green Woodpeckers, Greater Spotted Woodpeckers,Woodcock,Tree Creepers, Nuthatches,Tree Pippits, Sparrow Hawks and Tawney Owls. During the past few years there has been a resurgence in the Little Owl population,and there are several pairs in the area.
